results.name: Triangle T(n,k) in which the n-th row encodes how to hang a picture by wrapping rope around n nails using a polynomial number of twists, such that removing one nail causes the picture to fall; n>=1, 1<=k<=A073121(n).
comment: In step k the rope has to be wrapped around nail |T(n,k)| clockwise if T(n,k)>0 and counterclockwise if T(n,k)<0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..30, flattened
E. D. Demaine, M. L. Demaine, Y. N. Minsky, J. S. B. Mitchell, R. L. Rivest, M. Patrascu, Picture-Hanging Puzzles, arXiv:1203.3602 [cs.DS], 2012-2014.
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; local m; m:= iquo(n+1, 2);
mathematica: T[1] = {1}; T[n_] := T[n] = Module[{ m = Quotient[n+1, 2]}, Function[{x, y}, {x, y, r[x], r[y]} // Flatten][T[m], Function[h, h + Sign[h]*m] /@ T[n - m]]];
Table[T[n], {n, 1, 7}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 06 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
